subject: Prevent false-positive from systemd
commitMessage:
Prevent false-positive from systemd

systemd provides information about tmpfiles.d directory which
triggers error in CheckPkgConfig.py due to unanchored "/tmp" in the
regular expression.

Change-Id: I51946989292b35198c98207f6dbb7e807ffc0f36
Signed-off-by: Łukasz Stelmach <l.stelmach@samsung.com>

subject: Add multi-user support
commitMessage:
Add multi-user support

Removing user "app" from user list since, in multi-user architecture,
user names aren't known at build time so they can't be used in spec
files.

Removing group "app" from group list since, in multi-user architecture,
the user group is defined by the TZ variable TZ_SYS_USER_GROUP. To use
this variable as a macro in spec file you need to add: "BuildRequires:
libtzplatform-config-devel".

More information about multi-user architecture can be found here:
https://wiki.tizen.org/wiki/Multi-user_Architecture#tizen-platform-
config_usage

Bug-Tizen: PTREL-393
Change-Id: Ice67a8f789176ff195235b1ee7b77e4afa6789f4
Signed-off-by: Kévin THIERRY <kevin.thierry@open.eurogiciel.org>

Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

How does *removing* "app" from the lists of users and groups *adds* support for multi-user operation? Could you please give a bit more verbose commit message?

Please read the following pages and follow the guidelines for writing commit message contained therein.

* http://bit.ly/goodcommitmessages
* http://who-t.blogspot.com/2009/12/on-commit-messages.html
* http://dep.debian.net/deps/dep3/
* https://wiki.tizen.org/wiki/Talk:Packaging/Guidelines

Just a reminder: we'll probably have to add new static users/groups depending on the coming policy for multiuser security (guest, admin, ...)

subject: Update package groups list
commitMessage:
Update package groups list

Package groups list contained unused package groups and missing ones.

The list has been updated according to the sub-domains in the file
"domains" from scm/meta/git (sub-domains = package groups).

Note that "ValidNoneDomains", "ValidSubDomains" and "ValidDomains"
lists in the file rpmgroups.config have been emptied. They were used to
automatically generate package group but have no use with our current
package group list (there is almost no redundancy in the subdomains
names).

Bug-Tizen: TC-1499
Change-Id: Ie6c884635d7c5fdfe75fb63b62f51abc847bde15
Signed-off-by: Kévin THIERRY <kevin.thierry@open.eurogiciel.org>
